Pappas Developments looks to add to apartment portfolio with a Barber Greene complex

By  Elisa ReamerJanuary  

Elisa Reamer  Northern Star

 alderpeople at DeKalb City Council meeting on Monday PERIOD

DeKALB  The City Council will discuss passing an ordinance on first reading Monday to allow Pappas Development to annex . acres of unincorporated DeKalb to build an apartment complex on the land where Buhrs Landscaping and Lawn Care was on Barber Greene Road PERIOD The overall site is . acres of land PERIOD

Herb and Linda Buhr currently own the property but the land has been for sale for  years while their landscaping business has been closed for two years PERIOD

The proposed Arista Residences by Pappas Development will include  onebedroom fullyfurnished apartment units with  month leases the Jan PERIOD  City Council agenda reads PERIOD The units will comprise about  sq PERIOD ft PERIOD and the estimated monthly rent will be . the complex will include a hotelstyle lobby hospitality room business center gym and charging stations for electric vehicles according to the City Council agenda PERIOD

The agenda reads that there will be three entrances into the parking lot that will have  spaces PERIOD This covers . spaces for every unit PERIOD

There will be a right in and a right out along Barber Greene Road a full access entrance and exit off County Farm Road and an already existing access point along the north end of the property according to the agenda PERIOD

Before the consideration of this ordinance there will be a public hearing held at the beginning of the meeting where residents can speak on the record about how they feel about this potential development PERIOD

If the ordinance passes Pappas Development has requested a district change PERIOD According to the citys Unified Development Ordinance property annexed to the city is automatically zoned SFR1 SingleFamily Residential upon annexation so the applicant has requested a rezoning of the . acres from the SFR1 District to PDR Planned Development Residential District the agenda reads PERIOD
